Use the Forfiles Utility to Delete Old Database Backup Files

Posted on April 16, 2011

I came across a tool that some might find useful.  The Forfiles on Microsoft Technet utility (forfiles.exe) is preinstalled with Windows Server 2003 and later.  Forfiles enables batch processing of files.  One use of this utility would be to delete old backup files to remove dependencies on items such as... Using GUIDs as Primary Keys, or not

Posted on April 9, 2011

Also known as Globally Unique Identifiers, GUID values consist of a string of alphanumeric values which in principle should be unique across all machines of the network.  GUID values are stored in a database table using the uniqueidentifier (Transact-SQL) data type and requires 16 bytes of storage space per row.... [Read More]

Create a Database Mail profile in 4 Steps (or less)

Posted on March 26, 2011

Database Mail provides functionality to send email using T-SQL and is the successor to SQL Server 2000’s SQL Mail. Although SQL Mail is still available in SQL Server 2005, it is provided for backward compatibility only and the Books Online reccomend that Database Mail is used instead. Configuring Database Mail...
